title: Confusing terminology with compiler message for traits "parenthetical notation"

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
```rust
trait MyTrait {}

fn demo<T>()
where
    T: MyTrait(u8) -> u8,
{
}
```

```none
error[E0658]: parenthetical notation is only stable when used with `Fn`-family traits
 --> src/lib.rs:5:8
  |
5 |     T: MyTrait(u8) -> u8,
  |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #29625 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29625> for more information
```

Can we perhaps have something more in layman's terms?
Something akin to:
"you have used () for in a trait when you should have used <> instead"

More info [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46615275/how-can-i-define-a-trait-with-arguments-and-return-types-like-fn/46615691?noredirect=1#comment112199846_46615691)
